title: Insertion & Deletion Costs

description.core_idea: Adding or removing elements in an array requires shifting elements to maintain contiguity, which can be costly.
explanation: When inserting at a specific position, elements to the right must move one position forward.
When deleting an element, elements to the right must move backward to fill the gap.
Operations at the end (if space exists) are cheaper than middle operations.
key_points: End insertion is fast if space available

examples: Insert 5 at index 2 → elements at 2,3,4… move right by 1
Delete index 0 → all elements shift left by 1
common_misconceptions: Insertion/deletion in arrays is always fast
Memory automatically adjusts for new elements
